H0.text: Both plant and animal cells are where the process of cellular respiration occurs.

H1.text: Plant cells only are where the process of cellular respiration occurs.

H2.text: Animal cells only are where the process of cellular respiration occurs.

H3.text: Neither plant nor animal cells are the locations in which the process of cellular respiration occurs.

A4.text: Nutrients that are commonly used by animal and plant cells in respiration include sugar, amino acids and fatty acids, and the most common oxidizing agent is molecular oxygen (O2).

A5.text: Although plants are net consumers of carbon dioxide and producers of oxygen via photosynthesis, plant respiration accounts for about half of the CO2 generated annually by terrestrial ecosystems.
